sen.j: 東南院（とうなんいん）は、奈良県吉野郡吉野町にある大峰山の持護院。
sen.e: Tonan-in is Jigo-in of Mt. Omine located in Yoshino-cho, Yoshino-gun, Nara Prefecture.
Tonan-in houses the guardian deity of Mt. Omine located in Yoshino-cho, Yoshino-gun, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: jigoinをguardian deityというように解釈しました。
sen.e: Tonan-in Temple houses the guardian deity of Mt. Omine located in Yoshino-cho, Yoshino-gun, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 金峯山修験本宗別格本山。
sen.e: The associated head temple of Kinpusen Shugen Main Sect
It is the head temple associated to Kinpusen Shugen Main Sect.
It is the head temple associated to Kinpusen Shugen Main Sect.
En no Gyoja Reiseki Fudasho (sacred site for pilgrimage)
It is also the Reiseki Fudasho (sacred site for pilgrimage) for En no Gyoja.
It is also the Reiseki Fudasho (sacred site for pilgrimage) for En no Gyoja.
Sango is Ominesan
The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Ominesan.
sen.cmt: 山号の説明文を入れました。
sen.e: The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Ominesan.
The founder is En no Gyoja (a semi-legendary holy man noted for his practice of mountain aseticism during the second half of the 7th century).
It was founded by En no Gyoja (a semi-legendary holy man noted for his practice of mountain aseticism during the second half of the 7th century).
sen.cmt: The founder is > it was founded by.
sen.e: It was founded by En no Gyoja (a semi-legendary holy man noted for his practice of mountain aseticism during the second half of the 7th century).

sen.j: 霊地霊山は、霊地を開くときに中心になる伽藍を建て、そこから巽（東南）の方角に当たる所に寺を建て、一山の安泰と興隆を祈願した。
sen.e: When sacred places and mountains were opened, large Buddhist temple was built as a central facility, then a small temple was built on the place located in the east south direction to pray for the stability and prosperity of the mountain.

When holy places and sacred mountains are founded, first a large Buddhist temple is built as a central facility, then a small temple is built to the south-east to pray for the stability and prosperity of the mountain.
sen.cmt: この文章は現在形に変更しました。opened>founded.
sen.e: When holy places and sacred mountains are founded, first a large Buddhist temple is built as a central facility, then a small temple is built to the south-east to pray for the stability and prosperity of the mountain.

sen.j: 金峯山寺より東南に位置する。
sen.e: It is located in the east south of Kinpusen-ji Temple.
Thus Tonan-in temple is located to the south-east of Kinpusen-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: It > Tonan-in tenple. east south > south-east.
sen.e: Thus Tonan-in Temple is located to the south-east of Kinpusen-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 「Tonan-in temple」を「Tonan-in Temple」に修正しました。

tit.cmt: 他のファイルに合わせました。

tit.e: Cultural assets designated by the Prefecture
tit.cmt: 他のファイルに合わせました。

sen.e: Wooden seated statue of Dainichi Nyorai
Wooden seated statue of Dainichi Nyorai
Wooden seated statue of Dainichi Nyorai

sen.j: 近鉄吉野線吉野駅 (奈良県)より吉野ロープウェイ乗り換え「吉野山」下車、徒歩約10分
sen.e: Take Kintetsu Yoshino line and get off at Yoshino Station, then chage to Yoshino Ropeway and get off at 'Yoshinoyama' and walk about 10 minutes.
Take the Kintetsu Yoshino line and get off at Yoshino Station, then change to the Yoshino Ropeway, get off at 'Yoshinoyama' and walk about 10 minutes.
Take the Kintetsu Yoshino line and get off at Yoshino Station, then change to the Yoshino Ropeway, get off at 'Yoshinoyama' and walk about 10 minutes.
